snippet: Veterans have expressed frustration with delayed access to health care and an impenetrable and unresponsive bureaucracy at Veterans Affairs hospitals and clinics.
abstract: Hundreds of veterans around country respond to questionnaire on The New York Times website, expressing frustration with delayed access to medical care and impenetrable and unresponsive bureaucracy at Veterans Affairs hospitals and clinics; complaints are made even as many praise quality of care; comments give voice to findings that medical center officials used variety of schemes to hide increasingly long wait time for medical care.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Higuera contributed reporting from Phoenix.

lead_paragraph: Veterans have expressed frustration with delayed access to health care and an impenetrable and unresponsive bureaucracy at Veterans Affairs hospitals and clinics.

headline.main: Many Veterans Praise Care, but All Hate the Wait
headline.print_headline: Many Veterans Praise Care, but All Hate the Wait

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
